roleset.name: move upward dramatically, move up and over (like) in the gymnastics event
roleset.note: VAULT-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on vault-v.01 and corpus examples. Corresponds (ideally) to VNcls run-51.3.2. (from vault.01-n)

roles.note: DIfferences from vault-v: Arg0, causative agent in transitive usages, not included because no evidence of it in nominal usages has been found. If you see it, mark it 0 and send it in. Also, arg2-EXT has been omitted. (from vault.01-n)

example.name: just like increase, etc
example.text: Industry analysts suggest that the conquest of Falconbridge could vault Trelleborg from a regional Scandinavian success story to a world-class mining concern.
example.arg: from a regional Scandinavian success story

example.name: args 1,3,4
example.text: By his vault from 83rd position in the world rankings at the start of the year to the 15th place he occupied at the season's end?
example.arg: from 83rd position in the world rankings at the start of the year
to the 15th place he occupied at the season's end

example.name: gymnastics
example.text: Romanian gymnasts showed solid strength in the final of the women 's vault .

example.name: with DIR
example.text: His vault over the sofa back was an effortless synthesis of muscle, power, and perfect balance
